intro: Sclerolaena ramulosa, commonly known as the slender false thorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Sclerolaena ramulosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
